statement.p: A coffee distributor plans to mix some Ethiopian coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${9.10} per pound with some Queen City coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${13.50} per pound to create \displaystyle{10} pounds of a new coffee blend that will sell for \displaystyle\${13.06} per pound.
How many pounds of each kind of coffee should they mix? Round to the nearest pound. pounds of Ethiopian coffee. pounds of Queen City coffee.
